title: Template Build System for DRY Plugin Development
description:
Create a DRY template build system for Reaper plugin. Extract repeated sections from agents into reusable partials, create Node.js build script with EJS templates, restructure source under ./src/, output to project root.

## Execution Order (for reaper:takeoff)

**Phase 1 - Analysis & Design (PARALLEL):**
- reaper-pq5.1: Analyze agents
- reaper-pq5.2: Design template structure

**Phase 2 - Foundation (after Phase 1):**
- reaper-pq5.3: Create src/ structure (needs .1 AND .2)
- reaper-pq5.6: Build script (needs .2 only, can start when .2 done)

**Phase 3 - Template Conversion (PARALLEL, after .3):**
- reaper-pq5.4: Convert agents to EJS
- reaper-pq5.5: Convert skills/commands/hooks

**Phase 4 - Integration (after .4, .5, .6):**
- reaper-pq5.7: npm scripts and hooks

**Phase 5 - Verification (after .7):**
- reaper-pq5.8: Verify build output matches

## File Ownership
- .1: Read-only analysis (agents/*.md)
- .2: docs/build-system.md
- .3: src/partials/*.ejs, src/README.md
- .4: src/agents/*.ejs
- .5: src/skills/**, src/commands/**, src/hooks/**
- .6: scripts/build.js, package.json (devDependencies)
- .7: package.json (scripts), .husky/pre-commit
- .8: Verification only

title: Analyze agents and extract shared sections
description: Catalog all 17 agents, identify exact repeated sections (PRE-WORK VALIDATION, Directory Exclusions, OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS, Cleanup protocols), document variations per agent type (coding vs review vs planning). Deliverables: List of shared sections with line counts, variation matrix, recommended partial file structure. Files: agents/*.md (read only)

title: Design template structure and build script
description: Define EJS partial naming conventions, variable schema, build script architecture. Deliverables: Template syntax documentation, variable list (AGENT_NAME, AGENT_TYPE, etc.), build script pseudocode. Files: docs/build-system.md (new)

title: Create src/ directory structure with partials
description: Create source directory layout, extract shared sections into partial files. Deliverables: src/ directory with subdirectories, shared partials extracted (pre-work-validation.ejs, directory-exclusions.ejs, output-requirements.ejs, cleanup-protocol.ejs), README explaining structure. Files: src/partials/*.ejs, src/README.md. Blocked by: reaper-pq5.1, reaper-pq5.2

title: Convert agents to EJS templates
description:
Convert all 17 agent .md files to EJS templates that include partials. Templates use includes for shared sections, variables for agent-specific content.

Files: src/agents/*.ejs (17 files)

Acceptance Criteria:
- All 17 agents converted to EJS templates
- Each template uses <%- include() %> for shared sections (pre-work-validation, directory-exclusions, output-requirements, cleanup-protocol)
- Agent-specific variables defined at top of each template
- Templates follow naming convention from reaper-pq5.2 design

Related: reaper-pq5.5 (parallel work - converts skills/commands/hooks)
Blocked by: reaper-pq5.3

title: Implement Node.js build script
description:
Create build.js that compiles EJS templates to output directories. Reads src/, outputs to project root (agents/, skills/, commands/, hooks/). Handles all component types, clear error messages, optional watch mode.

description:

Files: scripts/worktree-cleanup.sh in the worktree-manager skill

- Protected branches (develop, main, master) skip this requirement

- All existing tests pass after changes
